title: James de la Rosa
text:
James Micheal de la Rosa (born 18 November 1987) is a Mexican professional <a href="Boxing">boxer</a>. He is currently signed with <a href="Don%20King%20%28boxing%20promoter%29">Don King</a>..
Early life.
De la Rosa was born on 19 November 1987, to a Mexican father and an African-American mother.
Professional career.
De la Rosa's first big win came against undefeated Abel Perry by 2nd round K.O. as the headliner of a <a href="TeleFutura">TeleFutura</a> card. On 3 October 2008, James gave the much feared Tim Coleman the first loss of his career. In 2010, he filed for bankruptcy, which canceled out his contracts with Duva Boxing and Cavazos Boxing. De la Rosa subsequently signed a deal with <a href="Don%20King%20%28boxing%20promoter%29">Don King</a>'s promotional company.
Personal life.
De la Rosa is the brother of <a href="light%20middleweight">light middleweight</a> boxer <a href="Juan%20de%20la%20Rosa">Juan de la Rosa</a>, who was a contestant on <a href="The%20Contender%20%28TV%20series%29">The Contender</a>.
